description:
Build a complete Chugli.ai Voice AI Platform dashboard website with a dark theme. Use the logo at /home/user/Images/chugli-logo-speech-wave-lrJ6m_0uOCFqaG1qx7mld.png as the brand logo.

Color scheme:
- Dark background: #0F0D1A (near black with purple tint)
- Card backgrounds: #1A1625 
- Border/accent: #252136
- Primary purple: #6B21A8 to #7C3AED gradient
- Accent purple: #A78BFA
- Text: White for headings, gray-400 for secondary

Pages needed:

1. LOGIN PAGE (/login):
- Centered card on dark background
- Logo at top
- Email and password fields with dark inputs
- 'Sign In' button with purple gradient
- Link to signup page
- Clean, minimal, user-friendly

2. SIGNUP PAGE (/signup):
- Same style as login
- Name, email, password fields
- 'Create Account' button
- Link to login page

3. DASHBOARD PAGE (/dashboard):
- Top navigation bar with logo on left, user avatar/logout on right
- Welcome message with user name
- 'Add Website' button (prominent, purple)
- Grid of website cards showing:
  - Website name and URL
  - Status badge (color-coded: yellow=pending, blue=scraping, green=ready, red=error)
  - 'View Agent' and 'Re-scrape' action buttons
- Empty state when no websites added

4. ADD WEBSITE MODAL/PAGE:
- Modal overlay or dedicated page
- URL input field
- Website name input field
- Submit button
- Cancel option

5. AGENT DETAILS PAGE (/agents/:id):
- Back button to dashboard
- Agent status with colored indicator
- Embed code section with copy button
- Code displayed in monospace font on darker background
- Success toast when copied

General requirements:
- Very user-friendly and intuitive navigation
- Smooth hover states and transitions
- Responsive design (mobile-friendly)
- Loading states with spinners
- Status badges should be pill-shaped with subtle colored backgrounds
- Use Inter font for text
- All inputs should have focus states with purple ring
- Cards should have subtle hover effect

Fix the logo image - it should display the Chugli.ai logo from the public folder (chugli-logo-speech-wave-lrJ6m_0uOCFqaG1qx7mld.png). Make sure the image path is correct and the logo displays properly in the navbar and auth pages.
Fix the copy embed code functionality - the copy button should actually copy the embed code to clipboard and show a success toast/feedback when clicked.

Redesign the UI to be more funky, creative and realistic while keeping the dark theme. Make it feel more alive and premium:

- Add animated gradient backgrounds with subtle moving purple/blue waves or aurora effects
- Use glassmorphism effects on cards (backdrop blur, semi-transparent backgrounds)
- Add subtle particle effects or floating orbs in the background
- Make buttons more interesting with gradient borders and glow effects on hover
- Add micro-interactions and delightful animations throughout
- Use creative card designs with gradient borders or neon-style accents
- Add animated status indicators (pulsing dots, wave animations)
- Include decorative elements like grid patterns, dot patterns, or circuit-like designs in backgrounds
- Make the empty state more visually interesting with illustrations or animations
- Add smooth page transitions
- Use creative typography with gradient text for headings
- Add hover effects that feel satisfying (scale, glow, color shifts)
- Make the overall feel more like a premium SaaS product with personality

Rebrand the entire website from Chugli.ai to Zukii. Replace all instances of 'Chugli.ai' or 'Chugli' with 'Zukii'. Update the logo to use zukii-logo.png from the public folder. Update any taglines or descriptions to reflect the Zukii brand name.

Create a stunning landing page as the homepage (/) that introduces Zukii - Voice AI Platform. The landing page should include:

**Hero Section:**
- Big bold headline like 'Turn Your Website Into a Voice AI Agent' or 'Your Website, Now With Voice'
- Subheadline explaining the value prop (scrape website, create AI agent, embed widget)
- Two CTA buttons: 'Get Started Free' (goes to /signup) and 'See How It Works' (scrolls to features)
- Animated visual element showing voice waves or AI visualization

**Features Section:**
- 3-4 feature cards with icons explaining the process:
  1. Add your website URL
  2. We scrape and learn your content
  3. Get an AI voice agent trained on your site
  4. Embed with one line of code
- Use funky icons and animations

**How It Works Section:**
- Step by step visual flow with numbered steps
- Animated connections between steps
- Show the journey from URL input to live widget

**Social Proof/Stats Section:**
- Fake stats like '10,000+ websites powered', '1M+ conversations', '99.9% uptime'
- Animated counting numbers

**CTA Section:**
- Final call to action with gradient background
- 'Start Building Your Voice Agent' button
- Maybe show embed code preview

**Footer:**
- Zukii logo
- Links: Features, Pricing, Login, Signup
- Copyright

**Navigation:**
- Sticky navbar with Zukii logo
- Links: Features, How It Works, Pricing
- Login and 'Get Started' buttons on right

Keep the funky dark theme with aurora effects, glassmorphism, and all the premium animations. Make it feel like a modern SaaS landing page.

Replace the Zukii logo image with the Chugli logo (chugli-logo-speech-wave-lrJ6m_0uOCFqaG1qx7mld.png) but keep the brand name as 'Zukii'. Display the logo image alongside the text 'Zukii' so the name is clearly visible. The logo should appear next to the Zukii text in the navbar, login page, signup page, and landing page.

Add a loading/splash page that shows when the app first loads. It should display the Zukii logo and name with a cool animation (pulsing, glowing, or morphing effect) before transitioning to the main content. Make it feel premium with smooth fade out after 1-2 seconds.

Fix all navigation and make everything functional:

1. Clicking the Zukii logo anywhere should navigate to the landing page (/)
2. Login page: Sign In button should work and redirect to /dashboard after login
3. Signup page: Create Account button should work and redirect to /dashboard after signup
4. 'Don't have an account? Create one' link should go to /signup
5. 'Already have an account? Sign in' link should go to /login
6. Landing page 'Get Started Free' button should go to /signup
7. Landing page 'Login' button should go to /login
8. Dashboard should check if user is logged in, if not redirect to /login
9. Logout button should clear auth and redirect to landing page (/)
10. All navbar links should work (Features, How It Works scroll on landing page, Pricing can be placeholder)

Make sure the auth flow uses localStorage to persist login state.

Make the landing page more visually impressive and cool:

- Add more dramatic animations to the hero section
- Make the voice wave animation bigger and more prominent
- Add a demo/preview section showing what the widget looks like
- Add testimonials section with fake reviews
- Make scroll animations smoother and more noticeable
- Add floating elements and particles
- Make the feature cards more interactive with better hover effects
- Add a pricing section with 3 tiers (Free, Pro, Enterprise)
- Overall make it feel like a top-tier SaaS product landing page

Fix the login and signup forms to be fully functional:

1. LOGIN PAGE:
- Email input field must be typeable (not disabled, not readonly)
- Password input field must be typeable
- Remove any placeholder that blocks typing
- Sign In button should validate fields are not empty, then save user to localStorage and redirect to /dashboard
- Show error message if fields are empty

2. SIGNUP PAGE:
- Name input field must be typeable
- Email input field must be typeable
- Password input field must be typeable
- Create Account button should validate fields, save user to localStorage, and redirect to /dashboard
- Show error message if fields are empty

3. Make sure all input fields:
- Have proper onChange handlers that update state
- Are not disabled or readonly
- Have proper value bindings to state
- Allow user to type freely
- Have visible cursor when focused

4. The form submission should:
- Prevent default form behavior
- Store auth token and user info in localStorage
- Navigate to /dashboard on success

This is critical - users cannot interact with the forms at all right now.
Fix the Zukii logo display - it's showing twice ('Zukii Zukii'). Should only show the logo image once with 'Zukii' text once next to it. Clean up the duplicate.

CRITICAL FIX: The login and signup forms are completely broken - users cannot type in the input fields at all. The inputs appear frozen/disabled even though they shouldn't be.

Please completely rewrite the login.tsx and signup.tsx pages with simple, working forms:

1. Use basic React controlled inputs with useState
2. Use simple native HTML <input> elements, NOT any UI library components
3. Make sure inputs have:
   - type='text' for email (or type='email')
   - type='password' for password
   - value={stateVariable}
   - onChange={(e) => setStateVariable(e.target.value)}
   - No disabled prop
   - No readonly prop
4. Remove any complex animations or CSS that might interfere with input focus
5. Use simple inline styles or basic Tailwind classes only
6. Make sure the form container doesn't have pointer-events: none
7. Remove the AnimatedBackground component if it's causing issues - use a simple dark background instead
8. Test that typing works before considering it done

The forms should be simple and functional first, pretty second. Users must be able to:
- Click on the email field and type their email
- Click on the password field and type their password
- Click the submit button to log in

Keep the dark theme but prioritize functionality over fancy effects.

Add Google Authentication to the login and signup pages:

1. Add a 'Continue with Google' button on both login and signup pages
2. The button should have the Google 'G' logo icon
3. Style it with a white/light background to stand out from the dark theme
4. Add a divider between the Google button and email/password form that says 'or continue with email'
5. For now, the Google button can simulate login by storing a mock Google user in localStorage and redirecting to dashboard
6. Make the Google button look professional with hover effects

Create a Profile/Account page at /profile route:

1. Show user avatar (large circle with user initial or profile picture)
2. Display user name and email
3. Edit profile section where user can update their name
4. Account settings section with options like:
   - Change password (form with current password, new password, confirm password)
   - Delete account button (with confirmation)
5. Subscription/Plan section showing current plan (Free tier)
6. Add a back button to return to dashboard
7. Style it with the dark theme, glassmorphism cards
8. Add the profile page to the router in app.tsx

Update the dashboard navbar to have a proper profile dropdown:

1. Clicking the user avatar/icon in the top right should open a dropdown menu
2. Dropdown should show:
   - User name and email at top
   - 'My Profile' link (goes to /profile)
   - 'Settings' link (goes to /profile)
   - 'Logout' button
3. Add smooth animation for dropdown open/close
4. Close dropdown when clicking outside
5. Make the avatar show user's initial with a gradient background

Add more animations and visual polish throughout the app:

1. Page transitions - smooth fade/slide when navigating between pages
2. Button micro-interactions - scale, glow, ripple effects on click
3. Card hover effects - lift, glow, border shimmer
4. Loading skeletons - animated placeholder content while loading
5. Success animations - checkmark animation when actions complete
6. Floating particles in backgrounds
7. Smooth scroll animations - elements fade in as they scroll into view
8. Input focus animations - expanding border, subtle glow
9. Status badge pulse animations
10. Avatar glow effect on hover
11. Staggered list animations - cards appear one by one
12. Hover tooltips with smooth fade
13. Modal open/close animations - scale and fade
14. Make everything feel fluid and premium

Replace ALL logos throughout the entire website with the new Zukii owl logo (39c819d7-24aa-4b3f-9b40-6f14c13896f4.png). This is a cute owl with headphones on a dark blue/teal circular background with circuit patterns.

Update the logo in:
1. Landing page - navbar logo and footer logo
2. Login page - logo at top of form
3. Signup page - logo at top of form  
4. Dashboard page - navbar logo
5. Profile page - any logo references
6. Agent details page - navbar logo
7. Splash screen - the animated logo
8. Any other places the old logo appears

The logo already has 'Zukii' text in it (yellow text at bottom), so you may not need to show the text 'Zukii' separately next to the logo - just show the owl logo which includes the name.

Make sure the logo displays nicely at different sizes:
- Navbar: around 40-48px height
- Auth pages: around 80-100px height
- Splash screen: around 120-150px height
- Footer: around 40px height

Remove references to the old chugli-logo-speech-wave file.

Replace all logos with the new simplified owl logo (zukii-owl-simple.png). This is a clean, flat teal owl with headphones on a transparent background - no circle, no text in the image.

Update ALL pages to use this new logo:
1. Landing page - navbar and footer
2. Login page
3. Signup page
4. Dashboard page
5. Profile page
6. Agent details page
7. Splash screen
8. Index/loading page

Since this logo has transparent background and no text, display 'Zukii' text next to the owl icon. Format should be:
- Owl icon (appropriate size for context)
- 'Zukii' text in a nice font with gradient or white color

Sizes:
- Navbar: owl ~36-40px, text ~20px
- Auth pages (login/signup): owl ~60-70px, text ~28px
- Splash screen: owl ~100px, text ~40px
- Footer: owl ~32px, text ~18px

The logo should blend nicely with the dark backgrounds now since it has no background circle. Add a subtle glow effect on the owl that matches the teal color.

Replace ALL logos throughout the website with the new Zukii brand logo (zukii-brand-logo.png). This is a sleek blue owl with headphones and 'Zukii' text already included in the image. It has a white/transparent background.

Update every page:
1. Landing page - navbar and footer
2. Login page - logo at top
3. Signup page - logo at top
4. Dashboard page - navbar
5. Profile page - navbar
6. Agent details page - navbar
7. Splash screen - animated logo
8. Index/loading page

Since the logo already has 'Zukii' text in it, do NOT add separate 'Zukii' text next to the logo.

Sizes:
- Navbar: ~50-60px height (shows full logo with text)
- Auth pages (login/signup): ~120-150px height
- Splash screen: ~180-200px height
- Footer: ~50px height

The logo is blue on white/transparent, so it will look good on dark backgrounds. Add a subtle blue glow effect to make it pop on dark backgrounds.

Increase the logo size throughout the entire website. The current logos are too small.

New sizes:
- Navbar (all pages): increase from ~56px to ~80-90px height
- Login page: increase from ~140px to ~200px height
- Signup page: increase from ~140px to ~200px height
- Splash screen: increase from ~180px to ~250px height
- Footer: increase from ~48px to ~70px height
- Index/loading page: increase to ~150px height

Make sure the logos are prominent and clearly visible. The logo should be a key visual element on each page.

Fix the 'Continue with Google' button on login and signup pages - it's not working when clicked.

Make the Google authentication functional:
1. When user clicks 'Continue with Google' button, it should:
   - Show a loading state on the button
   - Simulate a Google login by creating a mock user with a Google account (e.g., name: 'Google User', email: 'user@gmail.com')
   - Store the user in localStorage (same format as regular login)
   - Redirect to /dashboard

2. Make sure the button:
   - Has an onClick handler that actually fires
   - Is not disabled
   - Has pointer-events enabled
   - Shows visual feedback when clicked (loading spinner)

3. The auth store/localStorage should save:
   - isAuthenticated: true
   - user info (name, email)
   - token (can be a mock token)

4. After Google login, user should land on dashboard and see their profile info

Test that clicking the button actually triggers the login flow.

Remove the 'Continue with Google' button and the 'or continue with email' divider from both the login and signup pages. Just keep the simple email/password form without any Google authentication option. Remove all Google-related code from these pages.

Integrate the real backend API into the Zukii frontend. The backend is at https://zukii-backend.onrender.com/api

API Endpoints:
1. GET /websites - List all websites
   Response: Array of { id, url, status, vapi_agent_id, embed_code, created_at }
   Status can be: 'pending', 'completed', 'failed'

2. POST /websites - Add new website
   Body: { url: string, name: string }
   Response: { id, url, status: 'pending', ... }

3. GET /websites/:id - Get website status
   Response: { id, url, status, vapi_agent_id, embed_code, created_at }

4. DELETE /websites/:id - Delete website

Update the Dashboard page:
1. On page load, fetch websites from GET /websites
2. Display real data from the API in the website cards
3. Show status badges based on actual status (pending=yellow, completed=green, failed=red)
4. For completed websites, show 'View Agent' button that goes to agent details
5. For failed websites, show 'Retry' or 'Delete' options
6. Add a 'Refresh' button to re-fetch the list

Update the Add Website flow:
1. When user submits the add website form, POST to /websites
2. Show loading state while request is in progress
3. On success, refresh the websites list
4. On error, show error message

Update the Agent Details page (/agents/:id):
1. Fetch the website data from GET /websites/:id using the ID from URL
2. Display the embed_code from the API response
3. Show the vapi_agent_id
4. Copy button should copy the actual embed_code

Add polling for pending websites:
1. If any website has status 'pending', poll GET /websites/:id every 5 seconds
2. Update the UI when status changes to 'completed' or 'failed'

Handle loading and error states:
1. Show skeleton loaders while fetching data
2. Show error messages if API calls fail
3. Show empty state if no websites exist

Remove all mock/fake data - use only real API data.

Add a 'Live Demo' section to the Agent Details page that allows users to test the voice agent in real-time.

Add a new section below the Embed Code section:

1. Create a 'Live Demo' card/section with:
   - Heading: 'Live Demo' with a play icon
   - Description: 'Try your voice agent right here! Click the button below to start a conversation.'
   - A 'Try Voice Agent' button that activates the demo

2. When user clicks 'Try Voice Agent':
   - Dynamically inject the VAPI widget script into the page using the vapi_agent_id from the API
   - The script is: <script src="https://cdn.vapi.ai/widget.js" data-assistant-id="{vapi_agent_id}"></script>
   - Show a success message like 'Voice agent loaded! Look for the widget in the bottom right corner.'
   - The VAPI widget should appear as a floating button (usually bottom-right)

3. Add a visual indicator showing the widget is active:
   - Show 'Widget Active' badge when loaded
   - Maybe add an arrow or hint pointing to where the widget appears

4. Handle cleanup:
   - If user navigates away, clean up the injected script
   - Add a 'Stop Demo' button to remove the widget

5. Style it nicely:
   - Use glassmorphism card like other sections
   - Add an animated border or glow to make it stand out
   - Use a gradient button for 'Try Voice Agent'
   - Add some visual flair like a microphone icon or sound waves animation

6. Only show this section when the agent status is 'completed' (ready)

Fix the Live Demo VAPI widget integration - it's showing 'Failed to load voice widget'.

The issue is that dynamically injecting the script tag doesn't work well. Instead, use the proper VAPI Web SDK approach:

1. Use an iframe approach to load the VAPI widget reliably:
   - Create an iframe that loads a simple HTML page with the VAPI script
   - Or embed the widget using VAPI's official embed method

2. Alternative approach - use VAPI's official web SDK:
   - Install @vapi-ai/web package or load it from CDN
   - Use the Vapi class to initialize: `const vapi = new Vapi(publicKey)`
   - Call `vapi.start(assistantId)` to start the conversation

3. Simplest working approach:
   - Create a small inline iframe with the VAPI widget
   - The iframe HTML should include the script tag
   - This isolates the widget and ensures it loads properly

4. Or use direct script loading with proper async handling:
   - Check if script already exists before adding
   - Wait for the script to fully load and execute
   - Use a longer timeout for slow connections
   - Check if window.vapiSDK or similar global is available

5. Add better error handling:
   - Show more specific error messages
   - Add a retry button
   - Log what's failing to console for debugging

The goal is to make the 'Try Voice Agent' button actually load and display the VAPI floating widget so users can test their voice agent. This MUST work - it's a critical feature.

Fix the VAPI Live Demo - remove the broken SDK approach and use a simple working solution.

The VAPI Web SDK requires a public API key and has CORS issues. Instead, use a simpler approach:

1. Remove the @vapi-ai/web SDK usage completely - it needs server-side authentication

2. Create an iframe-based demo:
   - When user clicks 'Try Voice Agent', open a new popup window or create an iframe
   - The popup/iframe loads a simple HTML page that contains the VAPI widget script
   - This bypasses CORS issues because the script loads in its own context

3. Simple popup approach:
   - Create a small HTML string with the VAPI embed script
   - Open it in a popup window: window.open() with data URL or blob URL
   - The popup shows the VAPI widget floating button
   - User can interact with it in the popup

4. Or even simpler - just show instructions:
   - Remove the 'Try Voice Agent' button that doesn't work
   - Instead show a 'Test in New Tab' button
   - This opens a minimal HTML page (could be hosted or generated) with just the VAPI widget
   - Or provide a 'Copy Test HTML' button that copies a complete HTML file users can save and open

5. Cleanest solution - embedded iframe demo:
   - Create an iframe in the page
   - Use srcdoc attribute to embed HTML with the VAPI script
   - The iframe acts as an isolated environment where the widget can load
   - Show the iframe as a 'demo preview' area

Pick the approach that actually works. The key is to NOT use the VAPI SDK directly (it needs auth) but instead use the simple embed script in an isolated context.

Remove all the complex VAPI SDK code, event listeners, etc. Keep it simple and functional.

Fix the VAPI Live Demo using the VAPI public key: 919bbeaa-d657-4c72-a7b9-8772ac8ebd19

The VAPI Web SDK should work with a public key. Update the implementation:

1. Use the @vapi-ai/web SDK properly with the public key:
   - Import Vapi from '@vapi-ai/web'
   - Initialize with: const vapi = new Vapi('919bbeaa-d657-4c72-a7b9-8772ac8ebd19')
   - Start call with: vapi.start(assistantId) where assistantId is the vapi_agent_id

2. The public key authenticates the request, which should fix the 401 Unauthorized error

3. For CORS - the VAPI SDK should handle this when properly initialized with public key

4. Create a clean implementation:
   - 'Try Voice Agent' button initializes Vapi with public key
   - Starts the call with the assistant ID from the API
   - Shows call status (connecting, connected, speaking, etc.)
   - 'End Call' button to stop
   - Handle errors gracefully

5. Add event listeners for:
   - 'call-start' - show connected state
   - 'call-end' - show ended state
   - 'speech-start' / 'speech-end' - show when AI is talking
   - 'error' - show error message

6. Make sure the public key is used: 919bbeaa-d657-4c72-a7b9-8772ac8ebd19

This should work because the public key allows browser-side authentication with VAPI.

Fix the Zukii logo on the Agent Details page - it's showing a broken image icon. The logo file is 'zukii-brand-logo.png' in the public folder.

Make sure the logo:
1. Uses the correct path: './zukii-brand-logo.png' (relative to public folder)
2. Has proper height (~80px for navbar)
3. Shows the blue owl logo with Zukii text
4. Has the blue glow effect like other pages
5. Is clickable and goes to landing page (/)

Also check and fix the logo on any other pages where it might be broken (dashboard, profile, etc.).

Fix the VAPI SDK loading error in the test popup. The error is 'Failed to load VAPI SDK'.

The issue is the CDN URL for the VAPI SDK is not correct. Try these fixes:

1. Use the official VAPI widget script instead of the SDK:
   ```html
   <script src="https://cdn.vapi.ai/widget.js"></script>
   <script>
     window.addEventListener('load', function() {
       if (window.vapiSDK) {
         window.vapiSDK.run({
           apiKey: '919bbeaa-d657-4c72-a7b9-8772ac8ebd19',
           assistant: 'ASSISTANT_ID',
           config: { position: 'bottom-right' }
         });
       }
     });
   </script>
   ```

2. Or try unpkg CDN:
   - https://unpkg.com/@vapi-ai/web@latest/dist/vapi.umd.js

3. Or try skypack:
   - https://cdn.skypack.dev/@vapi-ai/web

4. Simplest approach - just use the embed script tag method:
   ```html
   <script 
     defer 
     src="https://cdn.vapi.ai/widget.js"
     data-public-key="919bbeaa-d657-4c72-a7b9-8772ac8ebd19"
     data-assistant="ASSISTANT_ID">
   </script>
   ```
   This should auto-create the widget button without any custom JavaScript.

5. Make sure the script loads and creates the floating button automatically.

Test multiple CDN URLs and use whichever one works. The goal is to get the VAPI voice widget button working in the popup.

Add a 'Download Test HTML' button next to the 'Copy Test HTML' button in the DemoPreview component on the Agent Details page.

The download button should:
1. Generate the same HTML content as the copy function
2. Create a downloadable .html file
3. Trigger automatic download with filename like 'zukii-voice-agent-test.html'
4. Use a download icon (arrow pointing down)
5. Show toast notification 'HTML file downloaded!'

Implementation:
- Create a blob from the HTML string
- Create object URL from blob
- Create temporary <a> element with download attribute
- Trigger click to download
- Clean up object URL

Style the button to match the existing 'Copy Test HTML' button style.
